stem: What is one benefit of applying firewall rules by tag rather than by address?
options/0/title: Tags on firewall rules control which ephemeral IP addresses VMs will receive.
options/0/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
options/1/title: When a VM is created with a matching tag, the firewall rules apply irrespective of the IP address it is assigned.
options/1/rationale: When a VM is created the ephemeral external IP address is assigned from a pool. There is no way to predict which address will be assigned, so there is no way to write a rule that will match that VM's IP address before it is assigned. Tags allow a symbolic assignment that does not depend on order in the IP addresses. It makes for simpler, more general, and easier to maintain, firewall rules.
options/2/title: Tags help organizations track firewall billing.
options/2/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/3/title: Tags in network traffic help with network sniffing.
options/3/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.

stem: In Google Cloud, what is the minimum number of IP addresses that a VM instance needs?
options/0/title: Three: One internal, one external and one alias IP address
options/0/rationale: That's incorrect. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
options/1/title: One: Only an internal IP address
options/1/rationale: That's correct! In Google Cloud, each virtual machine needs to have an internal IP address. The external IP address is optional; therefore, a VM instance only needs one IP address.
options/2/title: Two: One internal and one external IP address
options/2/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.

stem: What are the three types of networks offered in Google Cloud?
options/0/title: Default network, auto network, and custom network.
options/0/rationale: The three network types offered by Google Cloud are: default, auto and custom. Each project starts with a default network. The auto-type network uses the same subnet IP ranges as the default-type, with a network name other than default. A custom-type allows you to specify the IP ranges of subnets.
options/1/title: IPv4 unicast network, IPv4 multicast network, IPv6 network
options/1/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
options/2/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/3/title: Gigabit network, 10 gigabit network, and 100 gigabit network
options/3/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
